schema.name: Healthyfied Tuna In Citrus Soy Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Dice the white onion and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix the cornstarch with 2 tablespoons of water to create a slurry. Set aside.
Juice the calamondin to get the required amount of juice. Set aside.
Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the diced onion and saut√© until translucent, about 5 minutes.
Add the frozen tuna cubes to the skillet and cook until they are evenly browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the low sodium soy sauce, calamondin juice, the remaining water (6 fl oz), and salt. Bring to a simmer.
Add the cornstarch slurry to the skillet. Stir constantly until the sauce thickens, about 2-3 minutes.
Season with ground black pepper. Simmer for an additional 2 minutes to blend the flavors.

schema.description: Healthify your meals with this Healthyfied Tuna in Citrus Soy Sauce recipe. Rich in protein and low in carbs and sugar, it's an ideal choice for anyone looking to maintain a balanced diet without sacrificing flavor. This delicious recipe brings together the freshness of calamondin with the savory depth of low-sodium soy sauce, presenting a dish that exudes culinary sophistication while adhering to healthy eating principles. Perfect for the health-conscious food lover!
